title: HOW TO SETUP A WORM FARM + WHAT TO FEED WORMS | Vermicomposting | Hey It's A Good Life

tasks.task: Setting up a worm farm or bin.
subtasks: Gather supplies (cardboard, browns, bedding, grit, worms, greens, amendments, bin, water).
Add a layer of cardboard to prevent worms from escaping.
Add browns (shredded cardboard/newspaper, leaves) as bedding for the worms.
Include compost and soil to create a comfortable environment for the worms.
Introduce worms and add grit for digestion.
Cover worms with soil and compost to protect them from sunlight.
Add food scraps (bananas, apple cores, broccoli) in small quantities.
Cover food scraps with bedding material to deter pests and fruit flies.
Maintain proper moisture levels (about wrung-out sponge consistency).
Monitor moisture levels and adjust by adding browns or greens.
Address fruit fly issues by increasing browns and stopping feeding.
Allow the bin to air out when wetter than desired.
Understanding worm needs (correct bedding, diet, moisture).
Rotating food scraps and managing waste.
Using compost and castings to fertilize garden beds.
Farming worms for nutrient-rich amended soil.
Harvesting castings when bins are no longer productive.
